content:
We have 27 people that have either registered or agreed to facilitate a discussion. Here is the breakdown of time zones for these 27 people.

Orders-118158480195_-_Google_Sheets.png

StPaulTim said:

Orders-118158480195_-_Google_Sheets.png

Ohhh, two of us in the UK now :smile:

@jenlampton - Here is a link to the TAB with time zones on March 12th

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15MUJf9RMqi2Bk-cY3KhO0nypCsmwI4K3cJcM7h4GS7Y/edit#gid=443593654

BackdropCMS LIVE1
Draft Schedule <a href="https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/usa/san-francisco">San Francisco</a>,<a href="https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/usa/new-york">New York</a>,<a href="https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/germany/berlin">Berlin</a>,<a href="https://www.timeanddate.com/worldcloc...
How does this look for a schedule?
By the way. We decided during meeting that we really need to schedule next meeting before end of current meeting, then failed to do so.
How about next Friday, one hour earlier?
I got a calendar invite from Jen for Feb 5 starting at 2:30. It included Tim, Luke, and Greg as well.
Next Friday is fine with me :+1:

I know there's no easy answer to this, but here's a list of each of the event timezones and the number of blocks that have sessions scheduled between 6am and midnight (the times which I figure most people could possibly attend):

  • Oakland, Seattle: 4
  • Chicago, Dallas, Managua: 4
  • New York, Miama: 4
  • Buenos Aires, Brasilia, Santiago: 4
  • Berlin, Oslo, Madrid: 4
  • Johannesburg, Beruit, Athens, Cairo: 4
  • Tokyo, Seoul: 3
  • Sydney: 3

I.e. Americans wanting to attend sessions between 6am and midnight have 4 out of 5 blocks to choose from. Australians on the other hand only have 3.

Yes, I understand. There is a reason for this. We advertise Backdrop LIVE as 24 hours. But it's actually 27 hours. We added one additional block, because otherwise Block D would have been the last block during a time slot when most participants are sleeping. We thought it might be good to add one extra block as a final block to wrap up the event at a time when more participants would be available.

This one extra block is least advantageous to Australia and Asia. Which results in the numbers you calculated.

If it has been exactly 24 hours, the opportunities to participate would have been more easily distributed. But the event would have ended at the time of day when we have the least amount of participants.
Maybe next time we can try something different. Open to ideas.
The event could be started 4-6 hours later.

https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/775

Record ALL meetings/virtual events 路 Issue #775 路 backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
We have 3 different types of events/meetings in Backdrop: Weekly meetings Virtual user groups Backdrop LIVE events Of those, only the weekly meetings are regularly recorded. Since the Backdrop comm...
